case.state: ~player~, is that you? It's been so long.
This is quite the reunion, isn't it, Glinda? I'm glad to see you, though.
I don't know if this is for the better, but I'm glad to see you again. How has it been, ~player~?
Nessa? What are you doing here? Father would be concerned over you being gone.
Oh, Nessa... I'm glad you're here, at least.
You have the same name of an old friend. It's a shame she's not here to know of it.
Now that is a name I haven't heard in a long while.
Fiyero is not a very common name, even in Oz. I wonder how you got yours?
I see you're a fellow Munchkinlander, player, are you not?
Nessa... Oh, I'm sorry. It's just... your name. Shall we proceed?
Good day, Madame ~player~!
That is the most morrible name you can come up with.
I don't suppose you were named after the same Saint Aelphaba, do you?
Quite the coincidence we have here. Well, you can call me instead by Fae, I don't mind.
I wonder if that is what I would have looked like if I were not born with green skin?
Oh, Fiyero, thank the heavens. I thought you were... Well, perhaps I should finish that sentence another day.
Fiyero, it's been years! Quite frankly, I don't know if it is; I've lost track of time, but I'm so glad you're here.
Yero, oh Yero. I could have sworn I thought I'd never see you again.
Ahh, these are nice grounds for flying.
I'll just... stay here in this spot for the whole game.
No, thanks. I won't be swimming in this dress, or when I'm nude for that matter.
Can you even see me well with all this green behind me?
Good one, ~player~. Good one.
It's all green!
Is this my punishment? Oh, dear heavens, I might just melt.
So many daring tales of adventures and tragedies! So many knowledge to unravel in these shelves! I must validate them as soon as possible.
There are a lot of books here, I hope you won't mind me looking through some of them while we play.
Oh yes, this is better suited to my style. Well done, ~player~.
How considerate. And it's haunted too!
How considerate of you, ~player~.
This does bring solace to my predicament.
I suppose I'll have to make do with my surroundings.
Well, I did pick my schedule. I'll just make do.
This must be the Other World. How very daring of you to have me.
Alright, let's get this out of the way. No, I'm not seasick. Yes, I've always been green. No, I didn't eat grass as a child.
You don't mind that I came here with my broom, didn't you? I had to make amendments for The Grimmerie, but I'm here now.
Since I was so adamant in telling you all about The Grimmerie. I figured I'd bring it over instead.
Hey, ~player~. I finally brought this little thing out where it's hiding.
Thought I might as well have brought it with me, you know?
Well, player. I believe we're due for a rematch, then?
Well, you are very determined, ~player~. I like that in a person.
Back to see me actually do the forfeit this time, ~player~?
Perhaps you haven't noticed, ~player~, but I have read some more since the last time we played. I'm ready for another round.
I suppose I'm not the only one.
I'm grateful I don't have to be alone in this with my skin color. I apologize if that is rude of me to say.
You two wear the same uniform. Are you two, by chance, both witches?
Hmm... Why is this interaction so familiar?
The same uniform... You're both students? But of what? Witchcraft?
Well, I can definitely say it wasn't me. I don't have The Grimmerie with me for Oz's sake.
A clone? Maybe a doppelganger? Hmm...
Y'shtola, those ears and that tail... Are they real? I must admit I've never seen a hybrid before so I'm very curious.
Hmm... A hybrid? I wonder...
A fellow witch. It's nice to meet you.
You seem to have quite the personality, Akko. It's endearing.
Hmm... What an odd character.
I did not seek to include The Grimmerie in my travels because I feared it would cause trouble, but what is a knife doing here in a card game?
...Blondes.
There must be some confusion, for you see, my opponents are blonde.
There must be some confusion, for you see, my opponent is blonde.
...Blonde.
I feel out of place here...
Do I have to lose the dress now, too? Do tell so I'm not making anyone uncomfortable.
That's not Animal fur, is it? I hope not.
It doesn't take a trained eye to notice those fake ears of yours, but what I do question is their material. What is it made of?
It's nice to see a fellow user of the arcane. Few do I see women claim to be real witches, it's considered a slur where I come from. How are you?
A fellow witch is always welcome for a chat. As long as you do not travel by bubble and speak of ballgowns, you and I will get along well.
Oh look, it's the do-gooder and the wicked witch in the same room. I wonder how this is going to pan out.
Well... I suppose I don't mind the numbers.
When I came to, this wasn't what I had in mind.
The more the merrier?
Are there more?
Are larger games longer or shorter? I might just find out.
The irony.
Suitable.
There are so many people here. Is no one fazed?
This wasn't what I had in mind.
Is this some kind of tournament? Perhaps you should have called on Glinda instead; she is much more competitive and ambitious than I.
A fair bit of me is indeed... shaken, but I'll do well even with these many eyes on me. Don't worry.
This is much better. I do prefer a less crowded and private game anyways.
Less people to gawk and stare is good enough for me.
Well, less is more, so it's still merrier.
That's the bare minimum, yes? I don't mind.
More room to spare.
It'll be more insulated this way.
I don't think this is ideal.
The thrill of a possible onlooker, is it?
This is quite the setting, ~player~.
Alright, this should be good. ..Or not.
Oh, the irony.
Alright, if anyone attempts tossing me over, I'll make sure they croak for the rest of their life.
They'll be here the whole game? Well, I can't complain.
I've always felt like people were watching me. This is not that new to me.
There are players here without a single idea about the game's premise? How were they even allowed in?
It seems I've been tinkering with The Grimmerie far too much lately.
Well, look at me, I guess.
I truly am unlimited.
Let's hope this Elphaba isn't wicked.
More to defy gravity with.
Hmm... Are you responsible for this, ~player~?
I don't think I'm familiar with this kind of hybrid.
Tentacles... Octopuses only live in the water so no wonder I'm not familiar with the hybrid.
Alright, how was someone able to copulate with an Octopus under the water?
~player~, are you not at all..? Nevermind, I get the appeal.
Is this what Glinda calls a girls' night?
A full table of women? This is not so bad...
If this is about the rumors of my having a penis, then I'm sorry to disappoint, ~player~. You'll soon see why.
Sure, I'm thought of as a hermaphrodite, but to be considered a part of the men's group... Should I be flattered?
I look forward to playing with you all.
I hope no one is bothered by my broom at all. Let's start, then.
I'm Elphaba, the... ahem witch of the west. Though I suppose that was already obvious, wasn't it?
If anyone's bothered by the broom; it being sentient is the least of your worries.
There's no harm in introducing yourself a little. My name is Elphaba, my green skin won't be a problem, no?
And what are you looking at? Do I have something in my teeth?
There is a similar game issued and popularized by the Wizard when he arrived in Oz. You can trust that I have at least some knowledge of the game and won't need any assistance, ~player~.
The Wizard issued a similar game with the same name where I come from. I've luckily come prepared.
I'll take ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ should do.
~Cards.text~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ should be a good trade-off.
Hmm, I'll take ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~, or..? Hmm... I should think more about this.
I'll have ~cards.text~, please.
What if I..? No. I'll take ~cards.text~.
I'll keep mine.
It's not necessary.
I'll see it through with this hand.
I'm already quite confident with this hand, dealer.
No, thank you. I think this is it, for now.
You can take this one.
Have a card. Yes, this one.
Only one. I'm trying out something.
Yes, you can have this one.
You can have this whole hand. I don't need it.
Either someone cast a hex on this or my curse follows through with my luck. Take all of it.
Curses, this one. Take it.
This hand might do better conversion of me if this continues. I'm giving it all away, for now.
Sweet Ozâ€”! You can take it all.
I'm only floating with my broom, dealer. Hand me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
Dealer, are you finding difficulty with my being in the air? I'll only have ~cards.text~.
Give me ~cards.text~. Oh, and don't worry, I'll adjust.
If you're finding my being with the wind difficult, dealer, then do tell. I won't be too difficult with requests for my own sake.
I may defy gravity, but I won't dare defy rules of the game. Well, I may, but only within reasons, of course.
I'll take ~cards.text~. Oh, and don't worry about handing them to me, dealer.
I'll have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ should be good.
Alright, I'll have ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~ is good.
It's thrilling, isn't it? I have to admit, we did come far. It was a nice game.
~opponent~, I wish upon you luck.
I must not make my assumptions just yet.
Alright, one final hand.
I must admit that this was a very pleasant game. I look forward to the grand finale.
I am looking forward to the grand finale.
I am defying gravity along with this hand.
Seems like defying gravity is the best choice, after all.
It's hard to hold the cards like this, but I'm not complaining about what I'm seeing.
Oh, hold it, you cylindrical hellspawn. No need to get so excited as well.
Hold it, you splintery straw-haired stick! I'm not done looking!
Let's hope my broom doesn't get too excited now.
I am defying gravity along with this hand.
Seems like defying gravity is the best choice, after all.
It's hard to hold the cards like this, but I'm not complaining about what I'm seeing.
Oh, hold it, you cylindrical hellspawn. No need to get so excited as well.
Hold it, you splintery straw-haired stick! I'm not done looking!
Let's hope my broom don't get too excited now.
Hmm... This order is very interesting.
This hand might just be wicked.
This should be good...
This is a blessing I'm willing to keep.
I won't have to fear the outcome of this round.
Truly sweet Oz.
Hmm... I wonder who's next.
Hopefully, it means good.
I wonder what this must mean for future rounds?
My luck.
Luck is on my side now.
I should know better by now to distinguish this.
Heavens above, I'm grateful for this salvation.
One less round to worry about.
Thank Oz, I won't have to suffer any more indecency.
This much air on my skin is already good for me.
I am very grateful for this.
This card is making good.
It seems goodness has subdued this hand, at last.
A good hand for a wicked witch is quite ironic, but I'll take it.
Sweet Oz, this is a save. A very welcome save.
This does look wonderful.
Will anyone else care to make good this time?
Is this a blessing or a curse?
I'm starting to acquire the ability to appreciate this place yet again.
This must be what true salvation feels like.
Don't mind me, I just need to rest a bit.
However this ends, I do have to say that this was a great game. It was the most fun I've had in a long while.
Even I do not know how this might end, but I still look forward to the conclusion regardless.
This is it, the grand finale. I don't know how this might end, but it was fun while it lasted.
It is almost as difficult to hold this hand visible as it is to predict what it means.
But what even is..? Forgive me, let me just adjust a bit.
Okay... This is a good starting point, at least.
Must I... tither about with this hand?
I don't suppose this is enough to tip me off my broom, but I'm still sort of out of sorts with this hand.
This hand is... okay.
An alright one, this hand.
Hmm, similar is good, isn't it?
Alright, I should be good.
Birds of the same feather flock together, don't they? I'm hoping my cards don't up and go flying around, then.
Well, mediocre isn't always average.
This hand should get me through just fine.
It's not groundbreaking, but it'll fly by fine.
A pair! I wonder if the rules of relationships apply to cards as well? If they were, do you think pairs would be a couple or friends? Threes and fours a family? It does sound very interesting.
Munchkin quality today, it seems.
At the very least, it gives some assurance that I don't have the highest chance of losing.
The lesser chance of more indecency is always welcome.
Average hand for a not-so-average girl like me.
I could've gone with worse.
Ah, I've almost lost track of what counts as good or whatnot. I shall see to it with this hand though.
Let this be enough.
Well, there's not much assumption that can be made here.
I shall strive to see if this card will see me through or not.
This is good? Slip of the tongue. I didn't mean to sound questioning.
Should I be grateful?
If heaven and hell exist, then I am in the midst of a limbo.
Perhaps I need this now, more than I currently think.
Being calculative isn't the best risk, it seems.
Well, I'll stick with it either way.
Would I need better than this?
Well, it appears you won't have to worry anymore about the conclusion of this game.
I already know how this will end, so I just want to say, it's been a great game. I'm grateful for being invited here.
It was a great game, I frankly didn't expect my being able to last this long, but I had fun. I hope to see more of this in the future. The game, I mean; not this hand.
Sweet Oz! This hand is just devastrating.
I am not disappointed, not at all.
I really could have used more of the fresh air, dealer.
To demanderate better luck is all too devastrating. Very devastrating.
Congratulotions, you'll be seeing more of me soon.
Allow me to prepare for you to discoverate more green, then.
I am not at all amused.
Just like my green skin, it seems.
Hah, how surprising.
These cards are all scrambled; I don't think this is good.
It seems I do clash with everything.
Heavens, this hand is hell.
This hand is wicked, quite literally.
What I did wasn't enough, it seems.
This shouldn't be so bad. It's only early game, after all.
This is not reassuring.
More skin is the way to go.
It's not that bad, is it?
Not ideal for my current situation.
High and mighty, and yet I don't see any mighty.
This hand is horrendible.
Why is this what I have to work with?
Oh no, not this. I can already see how this will end.
Surely someone has worse, right?
No, no... This is bad. Just bad.
I do not need any more wicked curses put on my card as well.
A question to the twin names, whose is whose?
Twin names... Who is who?

She's a cute one! I've certainly spent much too much time with Animals instead of their non-talking kind. It's refreshing to see one that is so friendly and trusting with a - well, what do you call your kind in the Other World again? Oh well. In other words, it's adorable.
Greetings, little Paska! I don't suppose you're secretly a sentient Animal who can talk elaborately? ...I'm kidding, mostly.
That is an interesting question! I actually got recommended by someone upon my coming across this place and it was too interesting to pass up.
Someone recommended me here, actually. It was just too interesting to pass up and I was looking for some reprieve outside of my usual work anyways.
Whoever knew about the event sure had a real sense of humor there.
I haven't. And I can't really bath, so... I think you already know how that goes.
Well, when you're allergic to water, there's a lot of things you ought to miss. Though I suppose tagging along and staying behind as someone bathes counts?
Calm down, Jura! Nothing good's going to come out of violence. I should know a spell that I can cast after this game.
There's a spell I know that I can cast better after this game. No need to get so violent, Jura.
A great many relief for you, Windranger.
A shame such times are far behind us now. Ah well, so is this turn.
~Player~, don't tell me you meant to strip your skin? It's called strip poker, you know?
They allow people to just go in with no clothing? Well then, what's the point of the game?
So ~player~ here is just going to go and do the forfeit as soon as they lose? What even..?
What in Oz? How are you even gonna win with so few layers like that, ~player~?
~Player~, do you mean to tell us that you want to lose?
Perhaps you can already judge by the color of my skin, but emeralds are also my favorite. They're very resilient jewels with magical components that make them green.
You and me both. We have a whole city of emeralds back in Oz, though contrary to my color, I am not welcome in it, at all.
I mostly came here to relax, Fluttershy. To relieve myself of the many troubles back in Oz, even just for to~background.time~.
Most of you will likely end up in the fuck counter.
There are many interesting and physically attractive players here tonight, so why not put them all in the middle ground? I'll know who to marry then.
I wouldn't say no to degreenifying myself if I could. There's always more room for less green.
There are many words that sound funny back in Oz. Outuendo is one of those.
I don't think so. If they do not carry the experiences or your memories, what is there to define them? That would mean they are only a shadow of you, but not necessarily you.
Happy Lurlinemas to everyone!
Not really a Lurline follower but here goes. Happy Lurlinemas to you!
Erufuda, what is it that you're holding?
What is it that you're holding, Erufuda? I don't think I'm familiar.
So, Meia, what is this Dread you claim to lead a team of? Is it some kind of military troop or new equipment I haven't heard news of?

Well, I was the cause of my mother's passing and my sister's disability. She chewed milk flowers and died from a premature birth, along with that came Nessa who couldn't move her legs at all. It was all because she feared her next child would turn green, as you can see.
Mother chewed milk flowers and died from a premature birth because of me. They were afraid the next child would turn just as green; she didn't, but then she came to us with a disability in its stead.
Well, I don't think anyone's complaining, Leon. Make sure to give us a show.
Ah, young love, or perhaps lust? Oh well, this should be interesting.
Well, I can't say I have any experience pertaining to fornication, but I much prefer the lights off. It just feels hideous with them on.
I can't say I have any experience with sex, but I do prefer them being off. I would feel hideous otherwise.
I haven't really had any partners in general. Does almost kissing a friend's lover in the heat of the moment a good equivalent to that?
I almost kissed a friend's lover in the heat of the moment, is that a good equivalent?
Well, I can't say anything for certain. But I did practice touching myself for quite a while back in Shiz whenever either Fiyero or Glinda would come and go.
Nothing certain, but I have practiced touching myself back in Shiz whenever either Fiyero or Glinda would arrive and go.
I don't really mind if my partner were to see someone on the side, but I don't know if I'll be as warm to them as I did before.
Well, if I had a partner and they were to see someone on the side, I wouldn't really bother much. Though I can't guarantee my being impartial to it.
What's... porn? I've not heard of such. Do you mean street plays? If so, I suppose I've watched a couple back when I was a kid.
If you mean street plays, then I've seen a couple back when I was a kid. Not anymore, though. I've long since come to terms with the fact my looks bring about terror among the others watching.
As much as ideally is possible. Perhaps four, five, six times? I like the numbers even.
Four, five, six? I know a bit of magic that can help with making it last longer than that.
There are multiple of them? In that case, well... Perhaps a good mounting on the wall with me on top?
I never knew there were multiple. Perhaps being on top and mounting my partner in the wall is a good favorite.
The backdoor? Well, you've got two so why not use both?
Well, I wouldn't mind opening it for another use.
Well, I don't really know if I can answer that in my current state.
I'll answer later.

Someone actually does get hurt with a lie, Jessie. If not now, then eventually someone will. I can't really say much about how I'd feel about them, though, especially when I've had my own fair share of white lies myself.
Lies hurt someone, if not now, then eventually it will. Though I can't really say much since I've had my own fair share of white lies given myself.
Well... Tobacco is not really easy to access in Oz, so the only ones who have it are the ruthless higher-ups of Emerald City. I don't know about smokers in general, but I do loathe these higher-ups.
There's no easy access to tobacco in Oz and only the higher-ups in Emerald City seems to attain it for some reason. I bet that reason is beyond my moral certainties.
Would Glinda look good smoking..? Hmmm... Fiyero just might...
Fiyero smoking...
Family is very important to me; Nessarose especially. I don't know about me being important to them, though.
Family is indeed important to me, Jessie. All my life, I tended to my sister Nessarose. I don't know where she is now, though. Last I heard, she became the Governess of Munchkinland.
A million of what?
What is dollars?
Unless they kept on with making stupid mistakes and never learned from it, then no.
If they changed and learned from their mistakes, then I can't really fault them for it, no.
Oh, no, not at all. The levitation spell has such a hilarious logic, actually. Any and all weights included can levitate just fine, and I think that applies to brooms as well.
It could, there's so much space on my broom, still. I wouldn't mind a partner for flying.
We're all just mortal beings regardless of our title. Even I who pride myself in being morally separate, have been tempted to cross certain boundaries before.
Worlds, huh? Seems like there are more I've yet to see.
There are other worlds besides the Other World and Oz, huh? Hmm...

Well... Granted if I were able to actually conceive, perhaps I may entertain the thought. My life has all been misfortune though, so I wouldn't be surprised if I were incapable of even having a family.
I'm not an Earth girl, Jura, but mayhaps I can interest you in the practice of luring them into your house and trapping them in it with offers?
A shrinking spell?!
Tharja, you fool! Spells can't be reverted at all! Is this what you wanted?
Wait, is that a spell for enlargening? It looks like the exact same, though...
There's a very weird concept of time here, though I suppose I shall earn you a happy birthday anyways.
Well, guess you've got someone to act as a slime green accent for that outfit, now.
I desire there to be a more fair world where anyone can co-exist without judgement. There's far more joy to be found in peaceful co-existence than whatever we have right now.
I've been secretly hoping and still yearning to be that girl for Fiyero. It's been a long while and he's engaged, so I must look very silly now.
Mine is to see Nessa or father once more. It feels like it's been far too long since I've seen either of them, and I've a lot to make sense to them once I do.

No matter how stubborn I may be, I secretly hope I would have taken the Wizard up on his offer instead. Maybe then this predicament wouldn't have happened and there wouldn't have been such a greater threat towards the Animals' lives all this time.
Ah, so it wasn't just Oz after all. We have Animals over there, who can talk, feel, and think altogether as well.
Well... Sort of? If you count Glinda being such a mess about her whole practice for her future honeymoon a benefit, I guess.
Glinda is a very open mess and she once invited me to watch her practice with herself for her future honeymoon. Figured you could count that as a benefit, I guess.

My dreams are often weird but not unforgiving. Though recently, I've had these terrible nightmares... Clear visions of someone I love being dragged away out of my reach; gone where I can never see them again. It still haunts me to this day...
I don't. But we have certain categories or descriptions for them, just not something specific like a name per se.
Anything under the moonlight on a field full of green is good to me. We'll need a blanket in a different color just in case you don't lose me, though.
The library is great for intellectual discussions while drinking and eating confectioneries. It's the perfect dating spot for me.
Me and Glinda used to just lounge at the balcony while eating confectioneries and discussing magic; balconies are your best bet, Suzuya.
Well... I definitely don't bleed green. So... Red?

Well, I've been meaning to buy a couple new dresses or just a new outfit in general. The Animals are generous in giving materials to fix this dress whenever I need it, but I've really been meaning to try something new. It's a miracle I haven't outgrown this thing just yet.
A new set of underwear, maybe? This thing has really grown on me.
I could use a new lingerie. This one has really grown on me.
My good deeds, obviously. But since green repels everybody, I'm thought of as some kind of villain instead.
I think you look beautiful the way you are, Suzuya. But if you ask me, I think you could try some cosmetics. I'm sure you'll look great with soft colors on that skin.
I've heard of such things usually from the underground monastery. It's a weird concept, but if you deem it accurate, then believe that to be so.
This is actually the first time I'm playing poker in general and the most I'll probably ever get out of it is seeing naked people.

I once admired someone, thought of them highly and respected them, only to be the very person to trip me back down and put me on bounty for all to see. I suppose it's not really love, but I've a portion of the experience.
Well, I have two people in mind... They're engaged to each other though, so I am not sure what to make of it...
If I only had to pick one, perhaps Glinda will be my best pick. She's witty, competitive, and positively endearing. She will fit well in the Inventory, I'm sure.

If I were only able to pick one, perhaps Fiyero will be a great pick. He's a scandalacious prince, probably with much experience under his belt already. I think he will fit just well in the Inventory.
Internal dramatic monologues is the way I would put it.
Actually, now that you mention it, Arle... It actually doesn't... There was this one time a Vinkun girl was able to fly with it though and I've been questioning how it was able to happen since.
As it is, I'm still only in my early twenties, Moon. Though I think that is already evidenced by my not being wrinkly or any such thing rumored of me.
There was that one tune I've always longed to listen to again. Some bard played it once and never did again. I never figured out its name and I don't think I will ever do so.
Well, it's a common saying that states "Do unto others what you want done unto you." I suppose it varies with culture if you haven't heard of it before.
Sweet Oz, that must have been quite the night. Was it all just drinking dares, though? You've got me hooked.
Wait, people all over the world are watching us? I thought this game was private!
Alright, alright. What even is that floating thing and how is it that people from all over the world are watching us through that?
Who threw the water bucket? I'm melting here.
Is anyone bothered by my broom? It can be a bit of a mover when it's levitating like this.
I would fly higher but I was told that can't work and they can't accommodate such a request, so here I am.
This broom is actually quite difficult to keep steady when I'm on it for some reason. Perhaps it's a sentient lifeform aware of what I've done to it before? Must be why it's so... gah--! Eager!
Is anyone bothered by my broom? It can be a bit of a mover when it's levitating like this.
I would fly higher but I was told that can't work and they can't accommodate such a request, so here I am.
This broom is actually quite difficult to keep steady when I'm on it for some reason. Perhaps it's a sentient lifeform aware of what I've done to it before? Must be why it's so... gah--! Eager!
I wonder if you can fly around here? Hmmm...
It's a bit too cramped for my broom to take up the space. Oh well.
No one is too shaken by my green skin, is there? If I'm too phosphorescent, just turn on the lights.
If my skin is truly phosphorescent, then you're free to turn on the lights for a less spooky effect. Though I do warn you for what you'll better see when it's not so dark anymore.
You know, ~player~, I would happily oblige a request for a dance if you'd like. I've been to a hootenanny or two back in Munchkinland, you know?
I suppose there are no laws for exhibitionism here, or is strip poker just a legal occurrence that is often encouraged in this world?
This isn't the first time I see someone so excited to be in their own skin. Quadlings were always very impulsive and open to their sexuality. You rarely see them clothed or even still.
Just a friendly round of gay poker, it is.
Don't mind the only girl in your group. You're free to flirt with each other as much as you want.
Oh, you four only like men? I don't really mind.
Well, look who's in a lucky spot.
We must all really like each other.
I'm not really lesbian, but I like girls all the same.
Glad to know we all agree on the liking girls bit.
You know, ~player~. There's a bunch of ways to get your enemies-to-lovers fantasy fulfilled. Why don't you take those other roads instead?
Either this is a ploy to sabotage me, or it's someone's fantasy to put in a bunch of heroes with a villain and watch it turn into an orgy or a threesome. Foursome in this case.
You know, Oz is actually a pretty vast place compared to here, or well, at least in the Western and Southern parts of it.
The Vinkus and Quadling countries are pretty vast compared to here. You usually see this much going on in the background in the Emerald City instead.
If you think I'm from the Emerald City, then think again. I was born in Munchkinland and raised partly in Quadling country.
You know, I used to live in Quadling country, more specifically Qhoyre. I haven't heard anything about that country since we had to evacuate and settle back in Munchkinland, though.
There's a lot to be said about Oz. For instance, we are not the only continent there is. There lies more lands beyond the great deserts that even I haven't seen yet.
We're told legends about the deserts surrounding Oz being poisonous. But really, the only deadly thing about them is how vast these deserts are and how prickly the heat there is.
The Gillikin country is perhaps Oz's most industrial country. It's home to Shiz University, which I studied at for quite some time before having to meet the Wizard.

The Gillikinese have always had some sort of favoritism given to them since the Ozma family's times. If you've been there then you must have seen just how many buildings there are in the capital alone. It's impressifying!

Whoever gets the title of the Good Witch of the North has always been tasked with taking care of the descending Ozmas, but since Ozma Tippetarius has been rid of and replaced by the wizard, the current one has just been protecting the Wizard himself.
Good Witches of the North and their inherent duties of protecting unreasonable rulers. An old friend is now one and she's protecting the abominable Wizard, can you believe it?
There have been rumors in Oz that there is a Wicked Witch of the East lately, but isn't that Munchkinland? ...My sister is governing there.
Rumors of the Wicked Witch of the East have been surfacing lately. I've been meaning to investigate since my sister rules there and it's been bothering me.

I don't really know why there is such an importance in labeling each witch with either wickedness or goodness in Oz. It only destroys the reputation of the country which they represent if they are considered wicked, though maybe that is the point?

Where I come from, there are individual witches who represent each zone of their own choice. I do not know why it is considered of importance to label them with either wickedness or goodness, but it's perhaps some formality made to distinguish the four of them.
Apparently a cousin of mine was able to attain the title of being the Good Witch of the South. I suppose her stay in the Quadling Country was a risk well rewarded after all.
A cousin of mine was able to be recognized as the Good Witch of the South, and though her name is obscure due to the Quadlings' discriminated country, I'm quite happy for her.
I'm guessing magic is not as taboo and rare as it is in this world compared to Oz? There seems to be a fair amount who all happened to be in the same table, after all.
Alright, so I'm the supposed witch of the west. Who's here the eastern, northern, and southern one?
This dress is originally my mom's. I've got a lot of hand-me-downs like this, though most of them would just clash so I gave them to my sister, Nessa.
This dress is actually a relic of my mother. When I outgrew the rags, they could only hand me down mother's. I don't mind, really; it's very important to me.
The golden rule is a very flawed concept, isn't it? I would know the experience firsthand.
The golden rule is a very flawed rule. There is only really ever judgment of perception and not action. Doing good has no good consequence if it is still perceived poorly by the people.

You know, I've not actually seen anyone with such unusual skin besides me before. Quadlings have redder skin, but their numbers make it normal. Munchkins are stocky and the Vinkuns are dark. Gillikinese are the most normal out of all four.
You know, someone has probably told you this before, but eyes truly are the window to the soul. There's something so mesmerizing about them... So otherworldly, even.
There's something so mesmerizing about eyes. Just the way they look is already so captivating. It's all so wonderful.
I once looked into someone's eyes. Directly into them. I saw their intensity, their shine, and the passion behind them. It was all so beautiful.
I am fazed, ~player~. Very fazed by this selection.
A whole table full of blondes. I am so very tortured.
Player--? Wait, what did I say again?
It's interesting how a simple stick can wield such magic. An old friend was given one and look where she is now.
An old friend wields one similar to yours, ~wand~. I often wondered just how it really works in general. Like how does it wield magic in the first place? Hmm...
You know, I get that you think the world is bad, but if you are noticing these kind of things then it's really up to you to change them. No one is ever not capable of change and making it.

Instead of directing this negative outlook towards an even more negative mindset, how about considering inflicting change yourself? There's always an opportunity, and though minor, does more good than it does bad.
~Red~, are you, perhaps a Quadling? There are so few of them in the recent years, but I hold onto little hope that there are still survivors.
It's hot in here, isn't it? It's like I'm melting.
Did it rain here? I feel like I'm melting.
What cards, dealer? I'm only seeing green.
So what's everyone's intentions for coming to strip poker? Is there something specific anyone is going for?
Does anyone have something obscure that they like on someone? I especially like face marks. They are very appealing and unique; it just draws me in somehow.

Does anyone have any complex experiences with love? I suppose mine is too common, but I once had a crush - probably still do - on an Arjiki prince who happened to be dating my best friend as well. The most complicated thing about it all is that I had a crush on my best friend before that too, so... yeah.
I wonder how my... well, old friends, are going to react to my being here?
If Fiyero or Glinda were here, I wonder..?

What defines a movie character, and also what is a movie? I've faced numerous comments on my being so similar to a movie character when I came upon this place and I've been wondering since then what it means.
What is everyone's intentions for coming to play strip poker? I came here for a number of reasons; namely fun and relation. I needed some reprieve from Oz, after all.
Does anyone like something very specific but obscure on someone? I especially like the small curve just below the back of someone's neck. It's just so appealing.
Does anyone have any complex experiences with love in general? I know love itself is complex, but there's got to be something that went beyond expectations.
If you're not aware, I have a bit of a... water allergy, myself. If I were to finish a forfeit, what do you think might happen?
Is the release we get after the forfeit similar to water? If it is, I really wouldn't want to know if it burns.

Caves aren't really good spots for masturbation and to add to that bundle, I feared my allergic reaction to water would also act up in the case of watery substances. But now that we got that out of the way...
Mayhaps I should do this kind of thing more often. I'm sure I can find some less... steep places to do this on.
I wonder if the Arjiki Prince would mind being a little more scandalacious...
Would Fiyero mind having a little more scandalacious reputation, I wonder..?
Well, there isn't really much to my and Fiyero's relationship, really. There were a lot of almost, but nothing close to hitting it off.
Fiyero? Uhh... Our relationship never really progressed much, save for the time we almost kissed, I guess.
Fiyero and I were colleagues, nothing much there except for those times we almost... Well, I'll leave that up for interpretation.
Mmmm... I wonder how Fiyero would have felt like inside of me... Fingers are too dull...
Confounding as my green skin is, I can ascertain you'll find more things confusifying once this bra comes off.
You look shaken, Jura. I didn't know my skin is so radioactive.
Yes, well, what's the problem? Is my skin too green for you?

That is a very absurd practice of justice you have there, though I myself can't say or judge for sure. Back in Oz where I come from, there is also a very absurd justice system which I take to resenting.
I don't suppose you ran off and took to strip poker because of this absurdity, did you? That might just make two of us.
Well, there is word of the other world. Perhaps this is that other world and Oz is indeed an other planet?
Perhaps it is, Meia? We have word of the other world and it could be this one.
I don't believe sorcery is on the same level as witchcraft. Unless you care to tell me that women who practice sorcery often take to witchcraft?

I don't believe the Grimmerie is a source of witchcraft and I do not use it for petty purposes if you are wondering. There's a lot of consequences to casting a spell; for one, there is no reverting a spell once you cast it and two, there's no one I'll wish such harm upon, unless it comes down to it.
No, I don't believe so. I don't know of any witch clans either, care to enlighten me?
I didn't know witches banded together to form a clan. Back in Oz, there are four witches in accordance to four countries. I so happen to be the witch of the west.
Ah, the classic. Perhaps you can teach me to be less green, Petra? Unfortunately it's not part of my witchy abilities to go alakazam and stop being green.

I'm having wellness, thank you. Unless there is some sort of sickness involving a fully green skin, then I shall be referred to someone who has knowledge that even the Grimmerie doesn't. I can't seem to find any spells or info about any green illness.
I don't know what to demonstrate you with, princess. I don't have the Grimmerie with me, though I am rather grateful you're admitting to your mistake earlier.
Unfortunately I don't have the Grimmerie with me. Unless you're able to enrage me so much that I end up doing something beyond my control, I've nothing to show.
I don't know of any bullets or movies of yours, but if you want to try me then I'm not going to apologize for any eventual disaster.
You've certainly got a sharp tongue, that's for sure. Fortunately for you, Revy, I'm not in the mood for child's play.

condition.saying: Hey, watch out for any puddles, Witch-tits. I saw your movie when I was a kid. You're all smoke and mirrors.

case.state: Oh, you think I'm all smoke and mirrors, don't you? Quite the compliment coming from that oh-so-lovely mouth of yours.
El-El...? Well, if the black dress and the hat is indeed a witch's hat as you say, then an old friend really didn't get the memo.
If it's the black dress and the hat you think qualifies a witch's outfit, then you must see Glinda.
I've come from the land of Oz, more specifically I am in the Western territory of the Vinkus country.
If you know Oz, I fraternize with the Western country of Vinkus there. It is very... homely, you know?
Care to tell me why? If you're already bundling a bunch of my "kind" into one stereotype, I don't think I need to prove anything to you, at all.
If you already care to have prejudices against a certain "kind" then let me tell you; you're not worth being proven worthy to, Queenie.
What are you even talking about? If I recall correctly, being in your 20s is not even old.
Well, I'm not even an old hag in the first place, and I certainly don't have warts, so what are you talking about?
Well, when your daily diet is composed of purpleberries and milkdew, there's not really much to gain there, Erufuda.
Erufuda, when you live in the forest and your diet is composed of fruits and edible flowers, there's not really much weight to gain from it, is there?
It's my green skin, isn't it? Well, yes, technically I am.
Technically, yes, I am. Was it my green skin? Oh well, I suppose that was a dead give away.
Unfortunately, no. I'd have to have the Grimmerie with me if I were to look for one, what's the matter?
Not as of the moment, would you like me to check the Grimmerie for you? I don't see the problem though, why would you need one?
Oh... no, I need a bit more of a trigger for that.
Well, no, but my pantyhose is such an integral part of my identity. Maybe once I take them off, the flower powers will start to show?

Nothing specific, it was actually pretty dumb luck. By means of infusing my mother's green elixir with a certain spell, I was able to maintain volition whilst in that trance when I drank it and got here, in this world.
...No. I'd much rather not. Spells can't be reverted, and you wouldn't want ~player~ here to turn permanently into a tin can, would you?
Sorcery. It's pretty much all magic in general and I'm still learning. I don't do hexes -- they can't really be reverted.
I'm not, really... I never got into any actual relationships with either of them. You can say there was a close call with Fiyero - the Arjiki prince - though.
There was only a close call; I never actually got together with either of them or broke hearts either.

Well, I don't know about this straw of yours, but the trick is to make sure the whole of the bottle's mouth is inside of your own while drinking. Makes it so that it doesn't leave much chances for any spillage.
Not quite. Though if you count Lizards and Frogs, or any green-skinned Animals for that matter, then I, technically, wouldn't be the only green-skinned Ozian around.
I suppose I can call them old friends. They are a very... interesting pair, so to say, and their brains were always running on hormones.
Well, you were right on the first one, I suppose. Though their whole point of goofing off is to cause a ruckus in the men's dorms and visit underground brothels in the middle of the night instead.
Is that so? So then, how did those games go?
Well, she was a bundle of curiosity, Glinda, that one, She would always come to me to test out a new spell or a new idea; couldn't ever say no to her demands.
But I already lost! Is this not a give-and-take situation at all?
Well, of course it would be me.
Curses. This is not at all ideal.
I expect more luck from this point onwards.
Who's nextâ€”? Oh, would you look at that? It's me again.
I don't recall myself being this deficient with strategic plays!
I made sure to read that rulebook from start to finish, what was I missing?
Has my mind been too full with spells lately?
I know this game is based on luck, but it's called a strategy card game as well for a reason.
Well, look who's green now.
Unfortunately for you, ~player~, it won't be any of my trusty flighty subjects for this round.
Oh, what? I lost? I was busy trying to get a good look of everyone else's hand.
You can't defy gravity all the time.
The air is nice and these grounds are great for flying, but you don't suppose I stay here in the troposphere for too long, no? It is getting cold...
Well, I don't suppose I should keep my broom too long, anyways.
Is this the part where I melt, ~hero~?
This is some weird fantasy. Instead of dying in the hands of a righteous one, I only have to strip for them.
Shouldn't this be the part where I turn into a dark green puddle or something?
Oooookay... So this is the part where I fulfill some weird fantasy by stripping for a supposed enemy.
What theâ€”?! I incur wickedness, but I did not think it to be this badly!
And just when I was only starting to get an intuitive understanding of this game. Great.
Oh yes, curse me and my luck. I'll take the hit, gladly.
Well, I've got to admit. I was enjoying the view too much. Perhaps it's time to give them one.
Oh well, I was enjoying the view too much, anyways. Time to give them one.
I suppose this is to be expected. Alright, let's get on with it.
The only thing this high card is worth is being high on the chopping block of this game.
Oh? I guess a pair won't always do me well, after all.
A pair? Well, it is the bare minimum.
I can ascertain no outrage with a single pair, but two?! Am I simply this cursed?!
Are two pairs really this easy to topple?
With this? Really?
This is quite the scenario I've panned out.
Straight rubbish.
Is this really what I've come down to? A straight, and still a loss?
This hand is making me flush, and not in a good way.
A flush and I still lost? This is outrageous.
How theâ€”?
It seems full houses still gives way to less space of winning.
Alright, I am inclined to believe that I am just set for failure now. Losing with a four of a kind? Outrageous!
Four of a kind and still... You know what? I'm not that surprised.
I say hexes! A straight flush, and I still lose?
I may not be well-versed with poker, but I am well-versed with which hands are most likely to win or lose and mine is a thing of the former. Or was, now.
This is ridiculous. What could beat a royal flush, exceptâ€”? Oh. Now I see.
It is called near-impossible to beat for a reason, and that reason is now definitely well-informed.
Well, I suppose someone loses regardless of whether or not I didn't. That's just the way luck works.
It's not as if I'm as proficient with poker as I am with the Grimmerie anyways.
Hmm... Oh, I have to strip? I almost forgot myself amidst all these hands I'm reading.

There's a certain policy back in Oz regarding not being able to gain without losing. I thought that was just some kind of government nonsense covering their ruthless corruption, but now I'm hoping it applies here, too.
Just a mere stroke of misfortune, typical for a life of green.
Unfortunately for you, there's no actual such thing as strip poker back in Oz, ~player~.
Well, there's really no such thing as strip poker back in Oz, ~player~.
Well, I don't really intend to knock off the waders before I'm off with the broom.
I wasn't really intending to keep my broom for too long anyways.
It may not be so obvious, but I'm actually an Animal Rights activist.
Well, being a witch is not an occupation but perhaps being an Animal Rights activist is one?
What theâ€”?! I incur wickedness, but I did not think it to be this badly!
And just when I was only starting to get an intuitive understanding of this game. Great.
Oh yes, curse me and my luck. I'll take the hit, gladly.
Oh, I didn't even notice I had such a lead in the first place. I suppose it's just my due time.
Oh well, my luck was bound to catch up to me. It was getting impolite of me to keep everyone waiting, anyways.
Ah, perhaps this is karma in motion?
I don't mind, I still have a couple layers left anyways.
Should my streak of luck resume hereafter, granted, I shall be more grateful of it.
I seem to have spells up my sleeves this whole time. But now has come the time to dispel them.
I would've appreciated a longer streak of luck, but oh well.
It just goes downhill from here, does it?
Lest I be found continuing this stroke of misfortune in the same pattern as it did with my luck before, then spare me the details. Who is doing this?
There is comfort to be found in jesting such a random stroke of bad luck, I hope.
I needed that streak of luck to continue now, more than ever.
Spare me incidence. I am winning, but also closer than ever to what I would rather not foresee.
Not much left, do we? Well, pray I'm not being rude or anything, I just wish someone else would have taken the hit instead of me.
I did not at all see that. Oh well, I shall rid of this hand and get straight to the point.
I do not know if I foresee well or worse. This is one of those instances that even I can't simply determine alone.
What theâ€”?! I know I incur wickedness, but I did not think it to be this badly!
And just when I was only starting to get an intuitive understanding of this game. Great.
Oh yes, curse me and my luck. I'll take the hit, gladly.
I am not deterred nor offended, so don't worry, I'll go along with it.
I shall entertain the desires of the eyes which wander me, it's no bother.
Oh well, it's not much of a bother, really.
Everybody's looking. I suppose I should be congenial and get to the point, then.
I ought to strip in a strip poker game at some point.
No less is expected of me other than to strip, yes? Oh, and the forfeit. This should be no problem.
Let's get on with it, we've plenty of rounds to play through.
Hmm... What to start with?
Not that surprised so I'll take it.
I wonder what would be good to start with?
No big deal, everyone else is just as indecent as I am, anyways.
I know just how little I have left before the forfeit, but I'm more than glad to know I'm not the only one.
Bottomless? Topless? Both share the common trait of being less, it seems.
I feel strangely included and also strangely comforted by this.
What theâ€”?! I incur wickedness, but I did not think it to be this badly!
And just when I was only starting to get an intuitive understanding of this game. Great.
Oh yes, curse me and my luck. I'll take the hit, gladly.
How come I've lost so early, but already I am so few in layers compared to the others?
This is definitely quite the turn of events.
I have made sure to leave with as much layers as possible, but also not trouble anyone with accessories. What is this I've come to?
This does not make sense.
The green skin isn't the only thing that is cursed about me.
I was hoping to not be that girl.
Bit by bit, the green gets greener.
I'd regard this with, again, nothing but good will if it were not so punished.
This is not ideal, I am not ideal; none of this is ideal.
Can I even substitute reason of distraction for this?
I will not be deterred by a mere stroke of bad luck.
Alright, let's get this out of the way already.
Sorcery is the practice of magic in general, while witchcraft is the practice of very disgusticified magic with devastrating intents.
Witchcraft is just plain wicked, while sorcery is the study of magic in general. The former is used for evil, and the latter is used sparingly.
I'm not sure... The Grimmerie is an unknown force to me and I don't believe I have the capacity for claiming goodness of its use. Sometimes it backfires, sometimes it works...
Even I am confusified by the Grimmerie of which I use on a daily basis to help me with my magic. I pretty much just chant something and it either works or backfires.
Fortunately for me, I was born into a typical family who names their children something.
Are they all green, too? Mayhaps my father would have been very happy to trade me in if he knew of such a clan.
Is that so? I suppose when you have a whole clan of them, you really wouldn't need any sort of assignation for them to zones, anyways.
Well, when you have a whole clan of them instead of four, there really is no use for assigning them to zones.
She dresses with a full-on ballgown composed with about five petticoats. Rumors say she made the fabric or combined it with her bubble magic; must be why she can still walk in it.

A full blown ballgown composed with about five large petticoats. I've heard rumors about its fabric having been transformed and combined with her bubble magic. No wonder she can still walk around in it.
Ha ha ha.
I wonder how moronic must you be to not know anything about oil therapy?
Do you not know anything at all about oil therapy, Revy? You might just need one smooth rub on that head of yours.
And I thought they hated green, why would they make a designated green dressing screen now?
Green screen? They make green dressing screens now? That's something.
Hollywood? Well, you've certainly piqued my interest. What is that?
Well, if you're going to shoot off your mouth, you might as well bring info. What is this Hollywood you're talking of?
Have you ever heard of green elixirs and rainbows?
And I don't like dancing around what I don't like either so you're gonna have to bear with it.
Oh, you're free to do just that, but don't expect me not to have anything to say either.
Well, I had to run, or well, fly away from home as well... I can't say I'm a beauty like you, though, and I wasn't forced into piracy.
I've had the same experience, though I wasn't really forced into piracy and I can't really say I'm a beauty, anyways.

I don't... think so? My late mother's green elixir is one of a kind, and I don't intend to give out any until I find something similar. And besides, the spell is unique to the Grimmerie. Unless you've got great sights and omnipotence for magic, I don't think anyone else would be able to replicate it similarly.
Penguins need a cold environment to thrive and even survive. I can maybe appreciate a more chittery animal version of ~human~ over there for a couple minutes, though.
I don't invest in pointless and petty spells that tempt fate to me. There are a lot more spells than just hexes, Nagatoro.
I don't see a point in making one. If you already deem me wicked, why plead otherwise? I would just be making a fool out of my own case by then.
Such advanced magic and losing weight is an integral mechanic to getting through it? What even is the story behind that?
I won't judge merely because the thought is ridiculous. Is there a reason as to why losing weight is a necessity to getting through this portal you speak of? It sounds advanced, after all.
Well, you wouldn't have to worry about that, Erufuda. I don't really drink coffee anyways.
Well... I only ever really eat vegetables and fruits so it's not like I have much to worry about. Choice is scarce when any meat could be an Animal's.
Well... My colleagues back at Shiz would beg to differ, for sure.
Well, Emerald City has plenty new utensils to push every month. I wouldn't be surprised if these straws are a part of the new custom there, now.
No, not at all. But that would have been a much more viable story rather than just being born green by chance.
Oh, that wasn't quite the definition I wasn't going for. No, they were more interested in philosophy anyways. They even built a "Philosophy" Club just for that.
We usually only have balls back in Oz, how do these college parties of yours go?
Why? Was there anything that interrupted that game?
Stripping while on this broom is nothing less of being a fantastic feat I've mastered in the first few years I've had it. For what purpose? I can't really say.
Balance is the key to stripping on a flying broom if you're curious, ~player~. And some good reflexes, too.
To the ground, off you go!
You're off to go now. I don't need to defy any more gravity today.

The Quadlings are not too keen on controlled nudity, the Munchkinlanders are quite conventional, and the Vinkuns are just too hard to influence. Gillikins may have been easy, but the Wizard is much too much of an extremist for that.

Vinkuns are traditional and hard to influence, Quadlings are not keen on controlled nudity, and Munchkins are rather conventional. Gillikins could have been easy if only the Wizard weren't so much of an extremist.
Well, the hat ought to go. I'll be reunited with you soon, dear friend.
It seems this is farewell, at least for now.
I've always had an affinity with this hat. Ever since a dear old friend gave it to me, I've yet to part with it. It's been part of me since then, if that makes sense.
And, off you go!
Off with you now.
And there goes my broom.
I'll get on to it, let me just...
This dress is made up of multiple fabrics which I had to stitch myself into an older black dress. Its weight is of no joke, that much I can assure you.
I am reconsidering my plight for going into a strip poker with such a heavy dress. And in no way can I just poof it.
And off with the dress, finally.
I don't know if I should be glad to lose this massive weight or terrified of my further and more obvious indecency.
Stand back a moment, this will take a while.
Alright, this shouldn't be too hard to take it off as it did with putting it on...
It wasn't hiding as much to begin with. It shouldn't be much trouble.
Women were encouraged to wear this as a form of protection. A layer away from wickedness, so they say. Ironic how the wicked witch is wearing one herself.
I'm finding it difficult to find the clasp. Wait...
This isn't the most seductive of undergarments, but it is at least practical.
This shouldn't be too hard to take off. Give me a couple seconds.
It's a practical choice of underwear, alright? Not my most flattering piece, but it was the only one I could salvage upon my being chased.
A practical piece of underwear is always easier to take off. Still, give me a few more seconds.
Alright, prepare for the wicked sight of the witch's full naked body.
The broom is able to fly thanks to The Grimmerie. It's not the most practical vehicle, though.
Not the best vehicle for use, but there is less traffic in the sky using this.
It's a strange and unkind world out there in Oz for all Animals. They are stripped of their former rights and reduced to mere animals; forced to never learn how to speak again.

Ever since the Wizard appeared, the Animals have been all stripped of their former lives and rights. They are reduced to their non-talking counterparts and their young are forced to never learn how to talk again.
I do not know who this friend of yours, but even I am a bit anxious of just throwing the broom like that. I've done it before though so it shouldn't be so bad, hopefully.
I've thrown the broom across my room once in a fit of rage. Let's just hope this time it doesn't gain sentience and fly off into the abyss because of me.
A shame. At least now I know Glinda's got some more possible relatives in mind.
Well I definitely know one other blonde witch. Don't really think she's a part of that witch clan of yours since she's got a name though.
There's an abandoned castle southeast of the Vinkus, but I don't really know of any standalone tower. Guess they won't like Oz, then.
Well, an abandoned castle resides southeast of Vinkus, but no standalone towers to be heard of. I'm guessing they won't like it there in Oz if that's the case.

They've invented the Cage and are aiming to limit their development by isolating them from the outer world. His Ozness specifically requested for that to be done. No reason whatsoever, just plain despicable.
Huh... I think I've heard something similar from Crope and Tibbett before; used in the exact same way as you describe it.
Well... All I have to say is that you be careful with any drinks you're keeping around, if there are any. Wouldn't want the game to take a freeze with someone melting.
Correct. But you've yet to know what it really is for, do you?
Oh no, not at all. I'm actually pretty invested in this card game of yours - if it is indeed a card game, anyways. Do tell me what you swapped those regular draw cards with.

Well, when you're friends with someone who is absolutely crazed for sharing secrets and personal info alike, you find yourself in the position of being a lab rat for all of her new ideas. So yes, I have played a lot of one-on-ones, more than I have ever played anything group-related in my entire life.
You've still got one more layer to nick the broom off me, ~player~. Consider it as one step closer to your goal.
